bboxes.reason: The bounding box with index 5 correctly encompasses the 'Function' button, which is the control element we're looking for. This bounding box includes both the label 'Function' and the associated icon, which is the correct area for interacting with the function button on this induction cooker.

The bounding box with index 9 accurately captures the power/temperature up button, which is represented by the '+' symbol on the control panel. This button is clearly visible and matches the description of the power_temperature_up_button element we're looking for. It's a soft pad button that allows users to increase power or temperature settings on the induction cooker.

The bounding box with index 7 accurately captures the digital display of the induction cooker. This display shows numerical digits (88:88) which is the primary visual element for providing digital feedback to the user. It's located centrally on the control panel and clearly serves as the main digital display for the appliance.

The bounding box with index 8 correctly encompasses the power/temperature down button, which is represented by the minus ('-') symbol on the control panel. This soft pad button is clearly visible and matches the description of the power_temperature_down_button element we're looking for.

The bounding box with index 11 accurately captures the power button, which is labeled 'On/Off' and has a power symbol icon. This matches the criteria for selecting a button, as it encompasses both the label and the physical button area.
